abstract: Migration Policy Institute report finds up to 87 percent of unauthorized immigrants in United States would not be at risk of deportation under Obama administration's new enforcement programs; finds about 13 percent of estimated 11 million immigrants have criminal records or have crossed border recently, making them potential deportation targets.
lead_paragraph: Up to 87 percent of unauthorized immigrants would have “a degree of protection” to remain in the country under new enforcement programs, according to a report published Thursday.

headline.main: Most Undocumented Immigrants Will Stay Under Obama’s New Policies, Report Says
headline.print_headline: Most Migrants Will Stay Under New Policies, Report Says

snippet: Up to 87 percent of unauthorized immigrants would have “a degree of protection” to remain in the country under new enforcement programs, according to a report published Thursday.
